They need exactly to have a unique loot or something like that, just an interesting block if you want to
But serving mostly as point of interest and inspiration

Like this idea, but I would rather have end villagers over endermen.
If the veins were wayyyy smaller than the Iron and Copper ones, then that would be fine.
Abandoned villages are uninhabited, but Anthony12672 is suggesting that these be inhabited by illagers and witches. Additionally, I don't think these would have brown windows and cobwebs.
Good idea, but what would they look like?
villagers seem rather peaceful and they would probably not spy on the illagers. the other way around might make more sense
That may be true barryyu28, but what I was mostly thinking when I made the post was to maybe add some lore or  a bit of a background story.
I love this idea!!!
How to find map city for v0.16.0
Maybe if they finally add End Villages.

With the new caves we can all so add new stuff to the biome because it is cool to fined for the terracotta but you do not have mobs for that biome and it is pretty boring of a biome. my ideas for the caves is maybe a few mobs like a new skeleton we do not have many skeletons or a few desert birds that can be a pet new miner zombies and a new miner cap with a new villager for the paleontology up date that is coming with the caves and cliffs. like a new villager that sells you gear to do that. and the mesa will give you more stuff well doing paleontology like more gold like how more of it spawns in the biome it would make players like the biome for that.
sulfur should be an alternative to gunpower in crafting recipeis, and also should be highly flammable.

The Sulphur variant crafting recipe should require replacing some of the sand with charcoal and redstone dust. Clearly creeper variant gunpowder is more powerful than anything plain sulphur can offer seeing as it is literally mixed with sand of all things to produce the TNT. Furthermore I suggest simply using the sulphur, redstone dust, and charcoal mix I suggested to craft the gun powder separately. Though not flammable I hypothesize that due to its excitable nature and carbon + uranium + unknown element composition that redstone when squeezed and heated to a significant degree would produce enough heat at once to disperse the charcoal and sulphur while thermally accelerating combustion therefore creating a powerful explosion.

Seeing as real world coal naturally is rich in trace deposits of coal it would make since for some small amount of sulphur to be obtainable from coal.

Seeing as craters are good at holding water even when hot these naturally generated volcanic craters when of capacity to do so hold water. Perhaps there could be some kind of steam mechanic whereby water in such things as ponds and craters slowly evaporates, but is replenished by rain?
lol you say "It has no special properties other than it being affected by gravity." then you say, "Sulfur can be used in TNT instead of gunpower, and has a special property with fire."
Jaxon, I was editing and forgot to remove that! Thanks for letting me know!

Thanks for the feedback, Redstone Dreamer! I think what you said is a bit complicated for minecraft, but I do like having charcoal in the recipe! I also like the water idea, though I don't think the steam mechanic fits minecraft. But thanks for the feedback!
Honestly not bad
Would be a great Idea because we could use these for resources and as strongholds whenever we are at that biome it is in.

temporary solution that takes more work: you could use jigsaw blocks to piece structures together.

usually the idea w/ jigsaw blocks is to randomize structures from a 'pool'/folder of available structure files, but if you make each folder only contain one structure then you can use the jigsaw blocks to stitch together multiple pieces of the same structure without randomness.

no.

no.

the cake is a lie

Hello, this appears to be a non-English post. Below you will find a transcription of the topic being discussed.  

 

Title: “Abandoned houses in a caves”  

 

Text: “It's a good idea to add abandoned houses in caves or new abandoned structures in the caves for a better experience exploring the new caves of 1.17, that's my idea” 

 

- Translated by Admin

This is a concept image I created for one of the treasures found in the chests in the structure, most likely this would be a very rare find from one of the labyrinth chests, it is a crown. It could either be melted down into gold, or perhaps worn, giving you immunity against the Ghostly Soldiers, for they are loyal to the crown.

This design is jewel-encrusted, but when melted down it only gives you a few gold ingots (probably two or three), or perhaps this could add a new gemstone which can be extracted and then you can melt the crown into gold.
If anyone has suggestions for new treasures or items, feel free to tell me and I may be able to provide more concept images

I completely agree.  I feel the World Type: Floating Islands needs world generation fixed to be playable.

The geodes can spawn near or almost above island level.  I can't find any diamonds since there are no islands that generate at diamond level.  And as said above, the village buildings can spawn a the bottom of the world resting on the void and all the underground structures that mostly spawn air could use some surrounding blocks to help complete them.  I found a villager standing on his bed because he had no where to go other than the void.  Save the villagers!

Other than the village buildings only spawning on islands, I feel floating stone islands that rest lower in the world  could help enclose mineshafts, low lying ores, and geodes.  You could also go with stone peaks (maybe mountain/hill tops) that top out around lvl 32 and the islands don't go so far down.

The reason they didn't add Anvils to the Blacksmith was because it's too costly to just, give away for free. This is a similar situation. For experienced players, it's alright but for new players, giving away free Iron is too much and will remove the whole point of mining for Iron.

 

Though it's an amazing idea, don't get me wrong
Ye, I thought about that
If iron is rusted it could be in that formation
There could be golem-shaped structures made out of blocks that don't create golems
What if it was super rare, and the iron blocks were replaced with raw iron blocks?
The possibilities possible with 25w31a shelves are a lot bigger for aesthetic and technical opportunities than 32a shelves.
This is also much harder to see which item is in which slot so will make players less likely to use the hotbar swapping function with this smaller item design

Agree that it looks better vertically centered, more consistent, creates more building/detail possibilities; likewise it also mirrors the other purpose of the shelf as a hotbar swapper, since inventory items are centered within their frame as well.
Nah, just add some detailing to the top of the shelfs and make the items bigger. The items actually sitting on the shelfs looks way better

Besides this change, items/blocks placed on shelves need to appear larger like how it looks on bedrock edition. There are so many cool detailing tricks with shelves that simply aren't possible in the current snapshots because the item is either too small or (since 32a) placed awkwardly

I and a lot of people online agree, horrible change made by the devs. Nearly every design that utilized items within shelves as detail has been screwed. Not only is this change aesthetically displeasing, it hinders the intended purpose of the shelf. I hope they revert this change and give us back the better shelves.
It definitely looks better in the middle rather than at the very bottom, kind of hard to see, tbh

I dont think that keeping the new design is a bad idea, i like the item to be touching the shelf instead of floating around on the center, mabye just make the item big as the shelf's space so its more visible, you cant even see the item in the shelf from 3 blocks away.
I think it would be better to make top, middle, and bottom toggeable

My opinion on the shelf design has changed a bit. Some of the designs players have come up with, like using banners to create letters, are absolutely brilliant and work perfectly with the current shelf block. These creative uses show the potential of the block for aesthetic builds and clever design tricks.

That said, it’s hard to ignore that having the item floating in the center of the block doesn’t really make sense visually. It breaks immersion, especially in builds where realism or visual consistency matters. And when the item is placed at the bottom of the block instead, the overall appearance feels less harmonious. It gives the impression that something is missing or off-balance, especially when viewed from a few blocks away.

I believe that the current style of the shelf no longer fully fits the way players want to use it. So there are really two options: either we stick with the old system, where the item floated in the center, because it looked good and worked well with certain build hacks, or we redesign the shelf block entirely to make it look good with the item placed on the bottom.

A visual redesign of the shelf could help make the new item placement feel more intentional and cohesive. That way, the shelf would look natural and appealing again, and it would continue to support both creative and functional uses in builds.
It looks ugly, I'm not a huge fan of it personally.
It also makes more sense for the items to be centered since it's consistent with the way Item Frames display their items.

The new version makes more sense I guess, but we lost so much detailing potential. You can’t do smaller detailing, cabinet handles, signs with banners, none of that. They need to revert this change. They even look worse as shelves, you can’t see the items as well. Really hope they revert this. Other than this change though, this is a banger snapshot.
The new design makes the items way to small and un-focused for a block made specifically for showing off items. Bring back the 25w31a shelves!
I like to play beta minecraft with copper golem and others I'm waiting for new updates
Let's Vote Guys!

If they want a realistic excuse for the way that the shelf is, then they can simply make the excuse that the items are on a hook. You see the same thing everywhere in shops in real life, so they can imagine it the same way for the shelf in-game.
Please revert the shelves on Bedrock as well!

why don't we just make the items bigger? as a builder, the banner letters are awsome, but I much prefer them resting on the ground. why don't they just keep the same size and shift them down a bit, best of both worlds :D
Please change 'em back
Mojang please change it back it was perfect the way it was
I think at the very least banners should be reverted. It was so cool to have unique decorated signs, and they were already basically resting on the bottom of the shelf before the change.
yess please I really loved how it looked in last week's preview it was a lot better to look at and you can see it form farther away.

Please change the item placement back. i get what the new placement was going for. But for the sake of creativity and decoration sakes it just doesn't really work too well. Please don't let this be a copper bulb situation and just please revert the change.
The older shelf placement (centered and bigger items) allowed for much more creative building possibilities and was easier on the eyes. It was also consistent with the placement in item frames

They should really let you either place the item on the top, bottom, or center, with the bottom placement being how it is now, the center placement being the old one, and the top placement being something new.
Please Mojang, make them consistently big, seeable, and center, in both Java and Bedrock editions, it would benefit builders a lot.
The first iteration was PERFECT, it allows shelves to act like invisible item frames all it needs ia to make the display items be bigger
The old items on the sign looked sooooo much better, please consider reverting it Mojang, this is one of the best building tools we've been given in years, I don't wanna see it so nerfed.
PLEASE revert the changes made to shelf item/block displays, the current iteration is extremely detrimental to player expression.

‪Even outside of the banners not making as nice of signs anymore, the other items being so tiny is bad for accessibility, and makes them less efficient for labeling things like chests. They’re hard to see, and would be especially hard for a little kid trying to label their chests to differentiate.

I’m genuinely not sure why anyone thought this one was a good idea.‬ The item display was PERFECT first try when they first showed the shelves, I didn’t see ONE person with any gripes and the centered large items gave ENDLESS creative and decorative opportunities, it’s weird to see such uniform acceptance and praise of a feature and then watch the Mojang team immediately change it for the worse. I’d love to see the item display changes reverted to being larger and more centered in the block. Or even JUST larger. It doesn’t make sense for the items to be SO small. They look like ants.

Even if we ignore the possibility of building, when we consider items, it is impossible for angled items like swords, pickaxes, and sticks to stand upright at that angle, so in that respect I think the previous is superior.

The items were also made smaller.
This ALSO need reverting. 
The bigger items made the shelves fantastic for decoration, especially with creative banner usage in the shelves.
And also fix the block size so its not STUPIDLY small and is in line with how the blocks look dropped and in item frames
i agree, i think it looks wierd, and also theyre is a LOT of room above the blocks & items
Better alternative would be to shift right click between middle and bottom depending on what preference you have

We all accept that items "float" within an item frame, I don't think of shelves much differently than a new type of item frame with different functionality.

I understand that "gravity" would make items rest against the bottom of a shelf -- but we already accept that most blocks in the game don't obey gravity anyway.

Nobody would ask for items in your inventory or hotbar to rest against the bottom of each slot. Items on shelves looked better and were more easily distinguished when they were larger and centered.
I'd like it to look the same in both Java and Bedrock, taking the route the old version of the Bedrock preview took. Very big and centered
There should be an option to toggle between middle and bottom
pzdr z live
The old design is better
I agree and believe the recent change of this weeks snapshot is disrupting to the community's creative capabilities when building and coding. Plus for pete sakes, the original looked nicer.
shelves in bedrock edition is so better
I think it just looked cleaner and definitely better for decor. I love the bedrock edition look its big, clean and easily recognisable
it looks so bad at the bottom
This is basically the copper bulb all over again. Please, fix this. I don't care about realism. The game is a fantasy game for a reason. The version before looked so much better

Agreed, previous version had better creative possibilities. we are on minecraft, I don't care to have "Real Looking" blocks, I want to be creative as much as possible, and in this case the way it currently is, it's not creative friendly at all. Please Mojang revert this change....

I see some players complain about this change and some that don't so i think about adding a way to choose from this options: a wrench or just a keybind, i don't think the designs are bad but they should be choosed manually from the player, thanks

Edit: (choosing between an hook or no)
also make the items bigger on java like on bedrock edition

i understand that placing items in bottom makes it more realistic (and i guess it makes item frames more unique), but in minecraft i dont want realism. i want aesthetic, and new possibilities. that's why im voting for changing back item placement.

items on shelves should be in middle if it is supposed to be display and hotbar swapping tool, when they are on bottom, you cant see well items too high, limiting where you can place shelves and use them
You are gobbling our votes!! Minecraft will add this and forget about the useful ones!!!!!!!
zdecydowanie lepiej wyglądało jak itemy byly po srodku ramki

Thank you for all your valuable feedback on the shelf! Seeing the many creative ways you've been using this new block, we've decided to revert the recent change that positioned items at the bottom of the shelf, as we agree that having the items centered provides more creative opportunities when building.

I was hesitant about the shelf block at first, but I grew to love it for its building potential—both the back and the front (with the centered items). Now, however, the items are smaller and placed at the bottom of the block. This makes very little sense to me, as it greatly limits the shelf’s potential and creative uses. Now it just looks weird and out of place.
Im Having Kinda The Same Thing But My Shelf Displays On The Top Right

Yes please! The current routing logic seems very inefficient for the golems trying to deposit items if you have more than ~5 chests in your storage system, which is... most storage systems. And as much as I love them, I don't think I'd want 20 copper golems running around my base just to filter things somewhat efficiently. And in really large storage areas I don't really see them being used at all, which is a shame.

Honestly, I wonder if that would be too smart for the game to handle??

I'd rather if the golems checked chest more quickly; just running around, flinging chest open, and only stopping when they find a compatible chest OR return the item to the bottom of their copper chest and start from the top.

Could just have them detect what's in the chests, after singular exploration... then when game detects it has been changed, they can do the process again
But +1

I think ultimately it'd be more efficient if Golems just knew where you stored your items. The feature of looking at each checking each chest does create a sense of cute curiosity and whimsy but also auditory overstimulation (at least for me personally) and frustration. I have a LOT of chests with very few unique items per chest and my golems keep checking the exact same 3 chests rather than the other 30 in the room with them

That sounds amazing
mojang please add this
hacer que pueda agarar 32 items en una mano y 32 en la otra para que pueda yevar de 64 items alos cofres sinseramente yo como jugador tecnico no lo usaria si lo dejan con 16 items

Some possible routing logics:

  • Renaming a golem and a chest means the golem only searches chests with that nametag. Then you can have a "wood" section, a "stone" section, "tools" section, and so on.
  • Golems only sort from their level of weathered chest BUT can put items in a chest at the next stage of weathered. Then you divide your storage room between unoxidized, exposed, weathered, and oxidized. You still only have to dump items into one unoxidized chest beside the entryway.
  • Golems can read item frames and can put items in the chest that match the frames. Could be expanded to read item frames and put what's in the block-tag (ex. "small flowers" or "villagers pick up") in that chest.

These would speed up the golem sorting process but still put the responsibility on the player, which is usually what Mojang prefers.

Yes! They're cute as buttons, but not really smart enough to handle any large storage system. So either you have lots and lots of copper golems (Where do all the excess copper chests go?), complicated copper golem sorting hidden behind the walls (But now I can't squee over how cute they are), or really small basic storage (which is annoying both for ease of use, and because the last time I checked they still were trying to getting stuck on chests they can't physically reach).

PLEASE. I swear you give it ten chests, two rows of 5 on top of each other, and more often than not it checks three, then goes back to the copper chest, it's so bad. A simple memory that would know if a chest has been checked already or not in the 10 chest list would be fantastic, and then to add to that the ability for it to remember what was placed where would be SO helpful. Right now they just run around like chickens with their heads missing half the time, which makes them no help at all

And like the user above me said, they're cute as heck and I want to be able to see them run around and sort, but they're just too dumb right now on release to be useful at that without shoving them in tiny hallways where you'll basically never see them! I want to let them free roam around my storage room and look adorable AND be good at sorting, but they just aren't right now, and that's sad
This is a genius idea, and is exactly what we need for the copper golem. I want it to be useful so badly, but right now, it's frankly just not very helpful.

Copper Golems should at minimum remember the last item type / chest accessed rather than starting from scratch and searching ALL chests over and over when sorting stacks of items this one simple change would immensely speed up sorting.
I'm to intrusted that mojang created plan to make copper golems
The copper golem really needs its own associated copper button like it did in the Mob Vote.
Good concept but they are very picky on which chests they open and the order in which they open the chests. Hope this gets fixed!

I just posted something about the little dude! The Trial Chamber has the potential to accidentally spawn golems with just one awkwardly placed pumpkin. I'd like to have the copper rod included in their recipe, mostly for safety porpoises.

I love it but its not very smart, and gets stuck trying to find the right chest way too easily. It should be able to scan the X nearest chests when it grabs an item and pick the best one, and if no valid ones, randomly chose another further away

I don't quite see the reason for why they should spawn with a copper chest, when the chest itself is craftable, so in my opinion this mechanic should be removed.

It feels kind of weird that a two block golem structure converts not only into the golem but also another block, which does not even serve any special purpose (as far as I know about the workings of the copper golem).

I think there should be different options their sorting abilities to generalize vs specify.

I made a post about "programming" them to sort items differently and it's doing well so it seems people agree!
Love that this is coming to the game! However, one of the best original features was the ability to make statues with it. Can we reintroduce the ability to "freeze" them in one place?

This addition has got to be my all-time favorite one so far! I do have a few concerns that will probably be fixed by the time the Copper Golems are released, but I want to share them just to make sure Mojang gets a chance to see them.

The Copper Golem shouldn't take fall damage just like how the Iron Golem and Snow Golem don't take fall damage. Especially since the Copper Golem is made out of metal.

Chests should be removed from the copper chest crafting recipe since building Copper Golems also builds a copper chest without any wood being involved (or just remove the copper chest from spawning with the Copper Golem). Also, the modified recipe would fit in line with the other non-wood chest recipe: The Ender chest, which doesn't require a chest to craft. 

The Copper Golem should be made with two blocks of copper instead of one. One block of copper being enough to create a Copper Golem AND copper chest doesn't make sense. A copper chest alone requires eight copper ingots to craft, which means the Copper Golem is only comprised of a single copper ingot and a jack-o-lantern. If Copper Golems were made with two blocks of copper (arranged like how Snow Golems are built), then that means a Copper Golem is comprised of a block of copper, plus a copper ingot for the lightning rod on his head (or just remove the copper chest from spawning with the Copper Golem)

Regardless, thank you Mojang for adding the Copper Golem! :)
I think there should be a forth pose where the golem can hold an item. Or just some way to make them hold an item.
Please make the copper golem grabs 1 stack of blocks instead of 15

I feel that copper golems should prioritize chests that already have items in them over empty ones and should be able to detect chests that they can access via partial blocks. This would make it so having a 3x3 array of chests with a golem behind them standing on slabs to allow it to reach would improve its functionality, as you could then have a "misc" chest feeding via hoppers into a neighboring copper chest separated by a barrier.

overall idea seem fine but it should have better ways to filter what chests should be to be looked for, maybe making regular (and trap) chests with added copper ingot as target chests only, differentiating only with lock knob part that is gray be copper colored golems would then look for such chests only, making much easier integrating this into bigger storage systems and making overal easier to filter what chests you want golems look for and what you want to leave empty, by using copper lock chests and regular chests


lightning rod on head could have also some use, maybe any lightning would just speed them up significantly for while, or they could carry more items for limited time, not sure how practical but if they got lightning rod on head, they should interact with lightning in my opinion and as was told already, maybe it be needed in making golem

not make it spawn with chest, make chest being crafted only, while golem being spawn in world alone, makes it that you dont have excessive chests or golems, if you want more chests or golems only for whatever reason

maybe adding something like copper bell, using it to link golem to chest or block to be its "home" block to which it would always return if it do nothing, so it dont get pushed or lost too far from valid chests it can visit or seek

maybe adding "reversed" golem that would instead look for items from other chests and bring them to its special chest from there or would point you to chest with item, tuft one maybe
I would love a copper button that returns faster when pressed

I think the Copper Golem could pick up at least 32 items. 16 is a very small amount, and the Golem very quickly forgets the chest he just accessed. Picking up 32 items at once would speed up the process even more.

Currently (at least on the newest java snapshot) when you use a waxed copper block to spawn a copper golem, the chest is still an unwaxed one. It would make sense that if a waxed block is used, a waxed chest would be placed.

Olá, eu testei esse golem de cobre na versão preview do bedrock, achei muito util pra ele colocar os itens em uma sala de baús, eu acho que o que podia melhorar é ele organizar, exemplo: coloquei um ferro pra ele levar e tem um baú vazio perto dele e outrou com ferros, ele podia priorizar o baú que ja tem o item que ele está levando do que somente deixar em um baú vazio.

My biggest concern at the moment is, that the copper golem gets stuck really easily. So if it can only walk on a line of chests, it gets stuck at the third. Also they are not stackable, because they try to interact with the other copperchest. So building a sorting system is quiet hard. even more one that does not need to much space. 
I really love the idea behind the copper golem, even more because it does a job i normaly hate (sorting random stuff in chests). but at the moment it is not working in a way, that is really usable for me.
They shouldn't have to check every single chest. They should just be able to sense every chest within a certain radius of the copper one and automatically choose the correct one.

Someday, I'd like to be able to give the CoGo a bundle, and it'll use the bundle to increase its carry capacity and sortable items per trip. That sounds like a fair bit of coding that could go wrong, though.
Mabye adding a way to filter thing easily, like a menu
Copper golem gonna be op cuz me and my friends are making a minecraft world and are making a huge storage room and the copper golem and allay will be a huge help! Thanks minecraft!
The Copper golem should have green eyes now to match the new copper torches!
Is it in bedrock edition now?
The copper golem used to push buttons... But storing is cool.
The copper golem used to push buttons... But storing is cool. (Ps. I saw copper golem can work as lightning rod.)
Porfavor arreglen el problema del golem de cobre ya que para activarlo ya no puedes ganar los logros , quiero y porfa arreglenlo para que aparezca normal como el golem de hierro .

I love that the golem enables non-technical wizards to make an auto sorting system. But, when talking to my technically minded friends, they are mentioning that it is just too slow to use for "competitive" sorters and because of that they aren't very excited for it. So, what if there was a way to optionally speed up the golem? Like, have it go double speed when it's standing on a powered block (like a redstone block)? Or having some sort of enchantment? Or some sort of hard to get charge pack/battery thing?

Anyway, I'm very excited to use this feature. I think the most important aspect is that I can use it to sort my inventory (by dumping all my items in a chest). I think that would go a long way to solving the inventory issue.

When waxing the copper golems, on a bedrock realm, instead of the button saying “Wax On” it said “action.interact.wax_on” I am not sure if this is an all of bedrock edition, but it is like this on iOS

As somebody above has suggested, making it move a bit faster under certain conditions could be good. Maybe if the golem gets struck by lightning its speed increases? And then either when it turns into a statue, or simply oxidizes, it returns to normal speed? Could be interesting.
They need to be able to put bows, weapons, armor and other non stacking items into chests. It was very frustrating having to deal with that.
Copper Armor & Golem Lightning Boost – Vote me, I’ll vote you Mi title is : Copper Armor & Golem Lightning Boost – Vote me, I’ll vote you
Minecraft is my favourite game 🎮🎧 lets add minecraft pvp server of mojang studios

Me or an idea similar to yours please could you take a look (Oregolem – Master of Mining, Lava, and Loot)
thanks for your attention have a great day bye 👋
Can the copper chest be like the chest from the iron chest mod but make it so you can make a double copper chest as big four double chest in a copper double chest

Let them place items on nearby copper plates if chest are unavailable or when unable to pathfind to one. Instead of having them sit idle, if both chest and copper plate are unavailable allow them to place it back in the copper chest behind the rest of the chest inventory to have a chance to try again later
It would be a cool feature as well if dispensers could place blocks/items on copper golems' heads, to give players a new way to decorate without using commands.

I haven't actually tested it myself but based on some videos, the way I would see it work is: The golem would pick up 16 items (or less) from the copper chest at random (not only the first) and pick a target chest at random within a specific area. If there is no match in the first chest, it would keep checking other chests close by avoiding the ones (10) already checked. If it finds where to put the items, it would remember that last item and last chest. When it goes back to the copper chest, It tries to pick the same items as the last and then it would go straight back to the last chest and repeat that until all those items are moved. Then, if it's a new item or if the last chest does not match anymore, it would simply start at random again. If no matching chest is ever found, it could put the items back into the copper chest and start the random process again.

I loooove the idea! I'm the guy who made the first feedback post for copper golems, back in 2017, too. I think this is the perfect way to implement the little guys
... but in testing, they're a bit too dumb. I think a few issues with their "search for chest to place item" behaviour/AI task is holding them back significantly;

  • They keep targetting chests that they can't actually pathfind to.
  • They sometimes target chests that they can't even see, or at least shouldn't be able to see.
  • I've seen them look through the same double chests twice with the same item, even though that shouldn't happen, no? They shouldn't be checking the same place twice right away.
  • I've seen them give up on placing an item even though they were two blocks away from the appropriate chest, and they just never tried looking in it.

Also, they're just slowww. But maybe if their AI gets improved and they start working reliably, their speed might not be much of an issue, since we'd be able to just add more golems and expect our system not to break.

Personally, I'd like to have some of the Copper Golem's original concept with the copper button to be implemented. I like the idea of randomized redstone in the game. That way players could choose whether they want to use the mob for redstone or inventory sorting.

There are many posts with alot of upvotes for this, so I am merely reiterating the general consensus in the hope that saying it again will improve the odds of implementation,

Copper Golems need to have memory!

They need to be able to remember the contents of chests and sort items to those chests quickly. As is, their very limited AI of checking every chest every time renders them almost unusable in any large storage room. On top of that, they need to be able to reach chests stacked 4 high, which is the most common arrangement in player storage rooms. Both these changes are essential if a copper golem is to be compatible with most player storage rooms.

Ok, if nobody else wants to say it, why not (since they already become statues) make it so players can give the copper golems little gnome hats since they are already the Minecraft equivalent to garden gnomes?

Love the copper golems and the new features! It might be nice if in addition to these the copper button also got added for more decoration purposes and perhaps the golem would still press them randomly as a side feature?
Aleksander

Juego survival y en mi mundo se acumulan muchos ítems. Me es imposible crear una sala con 10 cofres para guardar todo; por este motivo opto por crear cofres con inventarios mixtos.

Para agilizar el proceso, me convendría tener 4 golems de cobre, pero estos se bloquean entre sí en el trayecto. Esto me lleva al problema de que no puedo tener más de 1 o 2 en una sala.

Los golems ignoran cofres, no llegan a revisar los 10 que tienen presentes. No le gustan los cofres superpuestos de dos en dos. = = = = = Optan por revisar solo los de arriba.

Pensé en crear varias salas de almacenaje con 10 cofres cada una, pero con la nueva habilidad, que pueden atravesar puertas, se me escapan del área de trabajo.
Cute as buttons, but they're still not smart enough to handle large open storage systems, and they can't reach high enough to function in storage set up for the player's convinence.
Small thing, but if the golem has no pathfinding options, it shouldn't search for a chest in its search radius, but in adjacent blocks only. Like if it's being surrounded by chests.

The Copper Golem is very good, but I was playing with the experimental version and I noticed a small detail that could be changed, when he takes an item from a copper chest and looks for a chest with the same item but doesn't find it, he gets stuck with the item and can't take it from his hand, that was very stressful, it would be really cool if we could take the item from the Copper Golem's hand or when he doesn't find the item, return it to the copper chest or find another empty chest for him to put the item there.
It should get a button that can turn it off and on that is made and connected to a copper golem by putting any button on the copper block that the golem is spawned from

Please add a Volume Slider that lets us make the copper golem quieter! He is always banging around the base, opening chests loudly, and the current "Friendly Mobs" slider does not work on him - the chest opening noises specifically.

On release the logic for copper golems really wasn't improved at all. They need at least a basic memory of item locations in the chests they sort for them to be useful, and they need to have a consistent path finding method every time. They are incapable of quickly sorting the same object to the same chest twice in a row unless placed right next to the chest they have to sort it into. If they are allowed to move around AT ALL they become wildly inconsistent and inefficient, which makes them basically useless compared to hopper sorters (which I do hate building and wish this lil guy could be a cute, low-tech replacement for!)

 

PLEASE Mojang, let them remember where they place an item when they place it correctly in a chest, so at least for basic sorters they can immediately know where they need to go! If you do, then all the copper golem has to do is go to that chest and check to see that the correct items are still inside and that is has space, and then it can place it, or if it doesn't, then it will delete that entry in it's memory and go back to the start of it's loop. Easy, and SO useful!

Could you make it so right clicking on a golem with an item lets you take the item from that golem? They kinda just gremlin items right now if they can't find a chest to put them in.

 

Also, crouch right clicking should convert them to a statue immediately at what ever oxidization level they were at, so you can manually move them around. I built a sorting room incorrectly and waiting for them to turn into statues to move them to the right locations was a nightmare

Copper golems are a bit rough around the edges right now. I only use them as decoration. I don't let them near my Great Warehouse because it's too big for them, and I don't want to implement auto-sorting because I don't need it yet. I'd like the developers to make them REALLY useful, or at least more painful than they are now.

This isn’t caclculess
i kind of think it should be able to fight

They are very cute, but I feel like the best fix for them would be to make it so once they’ve gone through all the chests in the area looking for a spot for the item they put it back in the copper chest and grab a new one. In my mind this would allow you to identify the problem items and then trouble shoot the problem. Copper golems are of course meant to be an early game alternative redstone sorting systems but at the moment they are largely useless and difficult to work with, especially if you want to incorporate more movement into your base and not trap them in a box.

Please make it so that if they don't find the exact item they're holding in a chest, they will add it to a chest of similar items (like sorting the creative inventory) I have to keep on taking items from it.

Put frost walker and soul speed on horse armor. Fits the goal (get across water) without requiring recoding the horses. You can already do this with datapacks actually, so it should be simple to implement in the base-game.

I agree, wam light is cozy generally, and on torches makes sense, but a lot of builds look awful and dark with it implemented so strongly and across the board. For example my main base is largely white concrete and smooth quartz inside, its meant to have a clean aesthetic to be a place where I can look at colors and think and plan builds, sort of a blank slate. Its a large bright open space, and its dark and feels like a cave now. 

More than it effecting any one build though, it simply changes the appearance of colors too strongly. White concrete, the most bright and flattest white color in the game, looks yellowed due to the effect when its any more than one block away from the sea lanterns I use for lighting, and the yellow look is substantially more pronounced with every block further away. This means you literally cant use white as a color inside of a build without sky light exposure. The end product will always have a yellow/brown tint to it, and that tint will be splotchy and uneven in almost any build.

I think a possibility could be to have it implemented differently with different lighting blocks. Blocks which make sense to have particularly warm light, torches, camp fires, magma, lava, could have warm lighting. But we should have the Option for lighting without those effects. Blocks like sea lanterns, end rods, and frog lights for example, look closest to florescent bulbs in real life and could keep the cooler looking lighting that preserves the visual colors of the blocks around them.

I agree, this should be reverted. Even if intended, mojang should consider the fact that lighting is a very important part of a build, and every single build made until now has been made with the prior lighting system in mind.

Though yes, torches and light sources in general did have a yellow tone to them, it wasnt this overwhelmingly noticeable. In areas that have enough light, you could well say the lighting is white, which is quite neutral and fits everywhere in the game.
The lighting has been made to just look extremely uneven, very white right next to the light source and very yellow at its edges. This change has ruined the Copper Age Drop for me.

1.21.9 in the nether is darker and cold light.

With night vision effect the light is lower than without light.

Plase revert this change of light becuse is not good.
Yea the whole backrooms lighting thing really sucks, it just overpowers block color so hard and outright ruins anything modern or uses bright colors and really hurts almost everything else.

Agree. The warm lightning looks pretty sick in builds.
Yellowish hue all over. Ruins them.

Please revert the lighting changes

It would be nice to have options for warm light, but it's not good for all lighting to be so warm, this seems like such a strange decision. Playing post 1.21.9 for the first time and it's extremely jarring.
This lighting change has ruined my builds. Why change something that isn't broken?

Agreed. Lighting from light blocks like torches has always been kind of warm, but with 1.21.9, I also noticed the glow is way too strong (yellow/orange). I noticed this while building my new house and started wondering if something was wrong with my game options or GPU settings.
I understand why this change was implemented but the effect was way overdone in my opinion. The old lighting was perfect, so why change something that works? Please revert it.

Completely agree, it's almost as if there's a massive clash with shaders too, I've used Sildur's shaders for so many years and now playing with it looks really odd, my shulker boxes are basically glowing, everywhere is so much darker despite lighting levels being at bay. 

They need to either add more settings to battle this, as tinkering with my settings has changed nothing and boils down to a Minecraft thing, or completely remove the feature, cos it's really off-putting.

Please let this be fixed or turned into a Vibrant Visuals toggle. This is not a good first impression of graphical changes to Java: more jarring than the Jappa texture update and out of player control.

When I saw copper golems I was afraid they won't be able to reach higher chests and I tested it out today. They couldn't reach it. I gave them ladders.
